article_title: A Stage-4 Gallblader Cancer Survivor Says: I Am One of ObamaCare's Losers
article_text:
Everyone now is clamoring about Affordable Care Act winners and losers. I am one of the losers.

My grievance is not political; all my energies are directed to enjoying life and staying alive, and I have no time for politics. For almost seven years I have fought and survived stage-4 gallbladder cancer, with a five-year survival rate of less than 2% after diagnosis. I am a determined fighter and extremely lucky. But this luck may have...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Edie Littlefield Sundby writes that she had great cancer doctors and health insurance before her plan was cancelled.
twitter.title: You Also Can't Keep Your Doctor

image.alt: Sundby: I had great cancer doctors and health insurance. My plan was cancelled. Now I worry how long I'll live.

article_metadata.author: Edie Littlefield Sundby
article_metadata.article.origheadline: You Also Can’t Keep Your Doctor

article_summary:
For almost seven years I have fought and survived stage-4 gallbladder cancer, with a five-year survival rate of less than 2% after diagnosis.
Everyone now is clamoring about Affordable Care Act winners and losers.
My grievance is not political; all my energies are directed to enjoying life and staying alive, and I have no time for politics.
I am one of the losers.
I am a determined fighter and extremely lucky.
